intro: Mesosorus dichotomus, commonly known as the forked sori fern, is a species of fern characterized by its distinctive sori arrangement. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to regions in South America. The plant features fronds that are typically pinnately divided, with sori that are dichotomously branched, giving it its common name. Mesosorus dichotomus thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its unique reproductive structures make it an important subject in the study of fern morphology and evolution.
